title: Data accompanying the DaparToolshed and Prostar 2 packages
text: basic example shows solve common problem:

title: Exp1_R25_pept dataset — Exp1_R25_pept
text: dataset final outcome quantitative mass spectrometry-based proteomic analysis two samples containing different concentrations 48 human proteins (UPS1 standard Sigma-Aldrich) within constant yeast background (see Giai Gianetto et al. (2016) details). contains abundance values different human yeast peptides identified quantified two conditions. two conditions represent measured abundances peptides respectively 25 fmol 10 fmol UPS1 human proteins mixed yeast extract mass spectrometry analyses. results concentration ratio 2.5. Three technical replicates acquired condition. dataset either available CSV file (see inst/extdata/Exp1_R25_pept.txt), QFeatures structure (Exp1_R25_pept). latter case, quantitative data raw intensities.

title: Exp1_R25_pept dataset — Exp1_R25_pept
text: object class QFeatures related peptide quantification. contains 6 samples divided two conditions (25fmol 10fmol) 13918 peptides. data frame exprs(Exp1_R25_pept) contains six columns quantitation peptides six replicates. data frame fData(Exp1_R25_pept) contains meta data peptides. data frame pData(Exp1_R25_pept) contains experimental design gives informations samples.

title: Exp1_R25_pept dataset — Exp1_R25_pept
text: object class QFeatures related peptides quantification.

title: Exp1_R25_pept dataset — Exp1_R25_pept
text: Cox J., Hein M.Y., Luber C.., Paron ., Nagaraj N., Mann M. Accurate proteome-wide label-free quantification delayed normalization maximal peptide ratio extraction, termed MaxLFQ. Mol Cell Proteomics. 2014 Sep, 13(9):2513-26. Giai Gianetto, Q., Combes, F., Ramus, C., Bruley, C., Coute, Y., Burger, T. (2016). Calibration plot proteomics: graphical tool visually check assumptions underlying FDR control quantitative experiments. Proteomics, 16(1), 29-32.
